result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy M Deford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stacy M Deford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stacy M Deford was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Defendant Stacy M Deford in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Severson states that there is a typo error on the summary section; dates are wrong.  Atty Hendee agrees.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant does not have any open cases anywhere else.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Severson makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail 
Report forthwith
Credit = 146 days
Court Costs = $243.00
of Right to Attorney
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has two open matters that Atty Brian Severson is on.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to proceed today without an Attorney.  Defendant did receive a copy of the revocation packet.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court denies the request of the defendant to proceed without an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant is to contact the PD office for appointment.  If denied, the defendant is to fill out paperwork for a court appointed Attorney.
Reset hearing
bond continued  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 23, 2017 at 11:15 am.
to Court from Stacy Deford
to Court from Colleen Sengbusch
to Court from Stacy M Deford
to Court from Stacy M Deford
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Defendant Stacy M Deford in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM108 & 15CM135 tracking together:
Atty Gumz is on a probation hold not connected to these matters.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM168 and Ct. 2 in 15CM108.  All other charges to be dismissed along with 15CM135.
Atty Lawton agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM168 and Ct. 2 in 15CM108.  All other charges to be dismissed along with 15CM135.

Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 15CM168 & Ct. 2 in 15CM108:  Withhold Sentence; 2 years Probation with conditions:
15 days in the Marquette County Jail on Ct. 2 in 15CM108
Sentence to commence forthwith
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count

Ct. 2 in 15CM168 to be dismissed
Counts 1 & 3 in 15CM108 to be dismissed
15CM135 to be dismissed
BY THE COURT:  Defendant was picked up; warrant quashed.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton which appears by telephone.  Defendant Stacy M Deford in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM135 & 15CM108:
BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied; defendant was picked up.

Atty Lawton states that he has had no contact with the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that she has called the COC office numerous times and wasn't told of the court date.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond on each case.  Atty Lawton asks that a return date be set soon; he has an authorization to appear

BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate the $250 cash bond for all three cases with the same conditions.
Defendant will need to appear at the next return date.  
Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark D. Lawton in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM108, 15CM135 & 15CM168 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that on 15CM108 the defendant appeared on March 24th in which today's date was sent and given notice.  In speaking with Atty Lawton, he has not had contact with the defendant.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Atty Lawton states that he has only had the case for about 3 weeks and asks that the warrant be stayed.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed for 7 days.

**Defendant appeared in court; warrant quashed.
Cash bond reinstated
*Not added with original warrants in 15CM135 & 15CM168

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM108, 15CM1356 & 15CM168 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee requests warrant on all three cases based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Atty Hendee asks that the cash bonds be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue on all 3 cases.
Cash bonds will be forfieted.

15CM168, 15CM108, 15CM135
Defendant wishes to contact the public defender.

with conditions:

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM135 and 15CM108 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear last week; warrant was issued and the cash bond was forfieted.  Atty Hendee states that the new case 15CM168; Ms. Deford was served today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that she did not have a ride.  Defendant states that she called the DA's office and left a voicemail.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed.

15CM168:

Defendant makes a statement to the court.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250.00 cash bond on each of the three cases with conditions
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. Cash bond to be forfieted.

Return date at 11-18-2015 03:30 pm
